column3: Concept ACK

This overlaps with #10193. However given it's a smaller change-set, and not solely about nuking Boost, maybe we can merge it first? Depends on how many other nearly/ready-to-merge PRs it's going to break.

@fanquake thanks for pointing it out, I wasn't aware of the other PR. This PR removes the macro and some Q_FOREACH loops over the other one, so it's a small difference.\n\n@jtimon can decide, I guess constantly rebasing such a big PR is a pain, so I don't mind for his to go first.
@ryanofsky thanks, I addressed all of your feedback.

Rebasing #10193 isn't hard at all, once I wrote the sed scripts once it's just running them again. The problem with #10193 is that the reverse iterator to replace BOOST_REVERSE_FOREACH isn't working for some reason. So I separated #10502 with the first 3 commits that could be merged right away.\nI would really prefer to do this using scripted-diff to make sure the removal is complete, on the othe
Needs rebase
@MarcoFalke rebased.
utACK b3489576c28e8e38f1321c1090f7342b75f485c0\n\nVery nice!
Can you write this as a scripted-diff?

> Can you write this as a scripted-diff?

Can't we just merge https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10502 instead?
Did anybody read https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10497#issuecomment-305564105 ?
@jtimon Cool!
As I said before, I don't mind at all to merge #10502 first. Then I don't have to repeat the effort of scripting the diff and after rebase this will simply be removing the macro.

> Can't we just merge #10502 instead?

So: close this in favor of #10502, as it encompasses more and is scripted?

The only difference is that this one puts `auto` in place of
`std::pair<type1, type2>`.

I think when this PR was started, the other one didn't deal with the Q_FOREACH and removing the pairtype macro (or I was blind ;)). Now that it does, I'll close this PR.\n\n(I don't mind the explicit std::pair annotation).
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10193 didn't remove PAIRTYPE until @tjps suggested it in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10193#discussion_r111326802
Bizarre that pairtype was defined in utilstrencodings.h.

I think this can be const auto.

This is preserving behavior, but copying CWalletTx isn't ideal. I made a change in #10500 to prevent this.
